meanings.definition: Having received more applications or requests than can be met or satisfied.
meanings.sent1: The popular new restaurant was oversubscribed, with people waiting in line for hours to get a table.
meanings.sent2: The concert was oversubscribed, leading to many disappointed fans unable to get tickets.
meanings.sent3: The oversubscribed party had guests overflowing into the backyard, creating a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The oversubscribed school program left many students on a waiting list, hoping for a spot to open up.
meanings.sent5: The oversubscribed event caused chaos at the entrance as too many people tried to enter at once.

meanings.definition: Subscribed for more shares, bonds, etc., than are available for sale.
meanings.sent1: Investors oversubscribed the new stock offering, eager to secure a stake in the company.
meanings.sent2: She oversubscribed for the limited edition sneakers, hoping to resell them at a higher price.
meanings.sent3: The group oversubscribed for the charity auction items, accidentally bidding more than they intended.
meanings.sent4: The customers oversubscribed for the exclusive product, causing it to sell out within minutes.
meanings.sent5: He oversubscribed for the concert tickets, not realizing he had bought more than he needed.
